instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. came in water damage.

now it chimes but i get no image (when i shine a light on the back i see no apple, also not with a different screen.)

i have 3,3volts on J9000 pin 4 so it is recognizing lcd.

I am missing <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>     0Volt.

<SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> comes from <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>
but am I wrong to think if I get a chime then <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> gets power?

what am I missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message: Im Assuming youve inspected the LVDS connector? try shine a light on the inside, see if the connectors burnt. Yes all main power rails are present if you are getting a chime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message:
Of course USB mouse will light up, it is chiming.
LCD is NOT recognized pin 4 is connected to <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL>! <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message: hi duke. 3.4volt on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message:
In this board I found out that if lvds connector is bad then <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> will appear only for first 8 segs. So you must check as soon as you connect magsafe.
Duke will correct me if I am wrong.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message: Pin 4 6 and 7 are needed for LCD recognition, check connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message:
pin 4, 6, 7 al are 3,3volts

<RESISTOR>R9008</RESISTOR> is 9,85k when no lcd kabel connected
<RESISTOR>R9009</RESISTOR> is 9,84k when no lcd kabel connected

red on pin 6 black on pin 7 gives me 19,87k lcd kabel not connected.

with kabel connected is drops to 6.4k (don't know if that normal don't have a second machine for testing)
I don't think that's good, but Ill wait for you :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message: These have no GPU and I doubt the PCH is bad. Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> again and the 100K pull-up resistor on this line. Inspect the LCD connector closely for corrosion and replace to be sure. You have done a PRAM reset?!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message:
Yeah I suggest you first find some Oscope tutorials. You need to set the time base to match the expected signal, also select DC coupled. There will only be a short burst of data on this bus after power on, this will be hard to catch so you cannot mess with the scope to find the correct time base. 
I dunno with this board now, willing to send it my way so I can have a look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but no display
threads.message: It says nothing, it is just a voltage. There is no data by the looks of it. The burst of data on this bus will be very short and you will need to "catch" it. No idea if your scope can store data like that,
